前期还好，多玩就能无伤，从中后期开始发力，个人感觉拉矿车卡时间跑过上面那条电路开始以后就有点上强度了，尤其是重力那几关，很多操作非常讲究极限，一个不留神要不就是迎来死亡或者重新操作，唯一友好的是死亡自动复活点都比较人性化，通常在每个小关卡前后。有些地方感觉设计是为难而难，根本没有一点容错率的。

185844558.review:
Un niño despierta en un bosque de aspecto perturbador. Sin conocer absolutamente nada de quiénes somos ni qué hacemos ahí, arranca un juego de plataformas que nos cuenta una historia sin utilizar una sola palabra.

Lo cierto es que no hay mejor forma de describir la narrativa. A medida que vayamos avanzando por el escenario, iremos observando una serie de acontecimientos que nos permitirán interpretar los hechos que nosotros creemos que están ocurriendo. Asimismo, el final nos hace intuir algunas cosas pero no nos revela nada, por lo que será tarea nuestra deducir qué ha podido pasar. Una forma novedosa y un tanto arriesgada de contar una historia, la cual en mi opinión resulta interesante debido a las teorías que cada uno de nosotros podemos desarrollar. Lo que sí que puedo aventurar es que no se trata de una historia infantil, más bien todo lo contrario. 

La jugabilidad consiste en avanzar por un escenario en 2D a través del plataformeo y la resolución de pequeños puzles. Pese a que me ha resultado muy divertido, el juego comete un fallo que para mí es el mayor pecado que puede cometer un juego del género: abusar del ensayo y error. Hay más de una ocasión en la que nosotros vamos a avanzar y por puro desconocimiento vamos a morir, independientemente de nuestra habilidad a los mandos, de forma que dicha fase únicamente la podremos completar tras un segundo intento y en el que ya conozcamos lo que va a ocurrir. Sinceramente, me parece que hay formas mucho mejores de introducir un pico de dificultad que esa. Afortunadamente los puzles que encontremos sí resultan muy satisfactorios, ya que requerirán de nuestro ingenio y precisión a la hora de encarar los diferentes desafíos plataformeros, por lo que en ese sentido tenemos una de cal y otra de arena. Me parece que lo positivo gana por bastante a lo negativo.

El apartado visual es totalmente monocromático, con un juego que transcurrirá en blanco y negro durante las 3/4 horas que nos puede llegar a durar. Me parece que ese estilo visual casa muy bien con la atmósfera tétrica y oscura que pretende transmitir la obra. El apartado sonoro contribuye a mantener dicha atmósfera, con una música un tanto lúgubre que nos acompañará durante todo el juego. 

En resumidas cuentas, una apuesta interesante si te gustan los juegos de plataformas algo más exigentes de lo convencional (no mucho más) con ese tipo de estética. Especular acerca de la historia resulta muy interesante, así que que no te dé miedo aventurarte a un juego con este tipo de narrativa.

Los puzzles son ingeniosos y desafiantes, y la narrativa implícita te invita a interpretar y reflexionar sobre cada momento. 185445348.review:
LIMBO - знакова інді-гра 2010 року від данської студії Playdead, яка вплинула на розвиток жанру атмосферних платформерів.

Цікаві факти:
• Розробка гри тривала майже 6 років
• Графічний стиль створювався під впливом німецького експресіонізму та старих нуарних фільмів
• Гра отримала понад 100 нагород
• Початковий прототип був створений одним розробником в його гаражі

Сильні сторони:
• Мінімалістичний чорно-білий дизайн, що створює унікальну атмосферу
• Продумані головоломки з чудовою фізикою
• Майстерне використання звукового оформлення замість музики
• Кожна смерть персонажа виглядає як маленька чорна комедія
• Атмосфера постійної небезпеки та самотності

Найпопулярніша теорія сюжету: Гра розповідає історію хлопчика, який потрапив у Лімб - місце між життям і смертю, шукаючи свою сестру. За теорією, обидва загинули в автокатастрофі, і тепер хлопчик проходить через власне чистилище, намагаючись возз'єднатися з сестрою. Похмурий світ гри - це відображення його підсвідомості та страхів, а всі перешкоди символізують етапи прийняття втрати.

Мінуси:
• Відносно коротка тривалість (2-3 години)

LIMBO - це взірець того, як мінімалістичними засобами можна створити глибокий та захоплюючий досвід. Незважаючи на невелику тривалість, гра залишає сильне враження.

185099620.review:
LIMBO — це гра, яка стала іконою інді-індустрії завдяки своїй атмосфері, унікальному артдизайну й простому, але кидаючому виклики геймплею.

Візуальний стиль LIMBO побудований на монохромній палітрі, що складається з чорного, сірого та білого. Таке мінімалістичне рішення чудово передає похмуру й напружену атмосферу. Силуети персонажів і об'єктів створюють відчуття постійної небезпеки, а м'яке освітлення й туман додають глибини та загадковості.

Основою геймплею є платформінг і вирішення фізичних головоломок. Більшість задач вимагають точності, терпіння й здатності мислити нестандартно. Втім, деякі моменти можуть дратувати через необхідність використання методу "наукового тику". Помирати тут доводиться часто, перш ніж знайдеш правильне рішення. 

У грі майже немає музики в традиційному розумінні. Замість цього гра покладається на атмосферні звуки: шелест листя, шум вітру, скрип дерев і глухі удари. Такий мінімалізм чудово працює на створення тривожної атмосфери, хоча іноді здається, що бракує яскравішого аудіооформлення для ключових моментів.

LIMBO — це гра, яка тримає напругу від початку до кінця, завдяки своєму візуальному стилю, атмосфері та геймплею. Вона ідеально підійде для тих, хто любить короткі, але насичені пригоди з елементами загадковості й страху. Проте її схильність до "методу проб і помилок" може не всім припасти до смаку.

185074922.review:
A really excellent game. I picked this one up to play on the Steamdeck and I'm super happy with how it performs, it runs at a locked 90FPS without any audio, video or control issues, you boot it up and it works flawlessly. 

The game itself is about 45m long from start to finish, so about 60-90m if you're playing for the first time (expect lots of deaths while you learn the puzzles) 

There's two really brutal achievements here, I thought I'd outline them here in case anyone else wants to achievement hunt. 

1) Completing the hidden level, which you can only get by collecting all of the secret eggs in the game. This level is incredibly difficult, with most of the level being in pitch black, so you need to listen to audio cues for when you need to jump and run. You'll need a guide for this one because it's brutal. The only saving grace is when you die you don't start the level over again, you respawn close to where you died. 

2) Beating the game with a maximum of 5 deaths. This one was hands down one of the hardest achievements I've completed, even though the game is only 40m long you can die on dozens on traps, costing you a life. 

There's about 6 really difficult sections in the game where you need to play perfectly, with the end final jump being arguably the most difficult to master (and where I lost multiple runs )

Even though you can use the chapter select to play the difficult sections and practice, it's doing the run from start to finish thats a killer. It took about 8 hours for me to get this one but I'm super happy I stuck it out because it really tests your mastery of the game. 

There's a few full playthroughs and even a few deathless runs but you'll only get this one if you keep playing and master each of the tricky puzzles.

100% recommend this game, it's an absolute gem

185060049.review:
Si me pidieran resumir en una palabra mi experiencia con este juego, diría: fascinante. Limbo es un videojuego breve e intenso, que pone a prueba tus habilidades e intelecto. En general, los niveles son sencillos y fáciles de resolver, pero te advierto que más de uno ará que tus dos neuronas suden bastante.

El juego logra desafiarte sin que te frustre o canse. Es tan fluido y está tan bien diseñado que te podés pasar todo el juego de corrido sin enterarte. De hecho, yo tenía que darle a pausa y ver mi progreso para darme cuenta de que ya me había pasado varios capítulos (así se llaman los niveles). Es un juego que te envuelve por completo; la ambientación, los rompecabezas, todo te atrapa desde el primer instante. 

Sin embargo, hay una única cosa de la que sí me quejaría: los controles. En sí, no es un juego con configuraciones complejas (literalmente, solo se usa 4 teclas en teclado y dos botones, más el joystick, en mando), pero me resultaron un poco incómodos en teclado, y el hecho de que no te deje cambiarlo a tu gusto (al menos, yo no encontré el modo) resulta aún más fastidioso. Por suerte, todo tiene arreglo en esta vida, por lo que creo que lo disfrutarás el doble si podés jugarlo con mando.

Sin duda, te recomiendo este juego, sobre todo, si amas resolver puzles y los juegos de plataformas. Limbo es una de esas joyitas de los videojuegos que no te podés perder.

185006604.review:
[h3]Limbo – The Art of Ambiguity[/h3]

[b][u]Style and Atmosphere: A Black-and-White World of Uncertainty[/u][/b]
Limbo is a game where its monochromatic palette serves more than just an aesthetic purpose. It embodies uncertainty and duality in a world where good and evil, life and death, blur into shades of gray. The atmosphere is heavy yet captivating, pulling you into a silent world filled with ominous shadows that feel almost tangible against your skin.

[b][u]Gameplay: A Journey Through Failure[/u][/b]
Every aspect of Limbo’s gameplay is designed to teach through failure. Traps, mechanisms, and puzzles push you to not only think but also take risks. Each death isn’t a punishment but a poignant reminder of life’s fragility. Limbo makes you ponder: can we ever fully anticipate danger, or must we accept the unknown?

[b][u]Story: More Questions Than Answers[/u][/b]
Who is this boy? Why has he entered this world? Is he truly searching for his sister, or is this just an allegory? Limbo offers no concrete answers, and that’s its strength. It’s not about solving mysteries but about confronting the questions that linger in your mind long after the game ends.

[b][u]Emotion: Silence That Speaks Volumes[/u][/b]
Limbo isn’t about action or triumph—it’s about feeling. Every sound, every shadow, every movement resonates deeply, striking a chord in your soul. The game leaves you in a silence that speaks louder than any soundtrack ever could.

[b][u]Conclusion: A Journey Into the Unknown[/u][/b]
Limbo is for those who are ready not just to play but to feel. It touches on our deepest fears and dreams, inviting players into a world where every step is a venture into the unknown. If you’re searching for more than just entertainment, Limbo offers an experience that will stay with you forever.

184872621.review:
Limbo was Playdead's first indie platformer in their mysterious style, and the style is still on point playing this game these days. As with all their games, the story is never spelled out and left to interpretation, as you are a young boy navigating an extremely hostile world with the 2d platforming. The art style, brutal death animations when you fail, and interpretive story are the best parts of the short game.

I will say after playing Inside (which has PERFECT level design and platforming), some of Limbo's sections were annoying in the later game. Not because I could not figure out a puzzle's mechanics, but because it required extremely split second perfect timing with your jumps and movement. So, you'd have to repeat it many times to get the timing right. I'd prefer trying to figure out a deeper puzzle than the annoying exactly timed jumps.

184580134.review:
Évaluation : 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 (5/5)
"LIMBO : Une œuvre d'art minimaliste, troublante et inoubliable."

LIMBO, développé par Playdead, est bien plus qu’un simple jeu. C’est une expérience visuelle et émotionnelle qui défie les conventions, plongeant les joueurs dans un monde monochrome où la lumière et l’obscurité dansent autour d’un récit énigmatique. Avec sa sortie initiale en 2010, ce jeu reste un classique intemporel du genre puzzle-plateforme.

Les Points Forts :
✅ Une direction artistique exceptionnelle :
LIMBO se distingue immédiatement par son esthétique monochrome minimaliste. Les graphismes en noir et blanc, combinés à un effet de flou et des animations fluides, créent une atmosphère oppressante et mystérieuse. Chaque scène ressemble à une peinture mouvante, plongeant le joueur dans un rêve à la fois beau et cauchemardesque.

✅ Une ambiance sonore immersive :
Le jeu utilise intelligemment le silence et des effets sonores subtils pour amplifier la tension. Les bruits ambiants, comme le craquement des branches ou le bourdonnement des mouches, jouent un rôle crucial dans l'immersion. L'absence de musique traditionnelle laisse place à une bande-son environnementale qui renforce l’impression d’isolement.

✅ Des énigmes intelligentes :
LIMBO propose une série de puzzles bien conçus qui exigent réflexion et précision. Chaque obstacle est intégré de manière fluide dans l’environnement, et la courbe de difficulté est bien équilibrée. Les mécaniques de gameplay, simples mais ingénieuses, encouragent l’expérimentation sans jamais submerger le joueur.

✅ Une narration subtile et ouverte à l’interprétation :
L’histoire d’un garçon cherchant sa sœur est racontée sans dialogues ni textes explicatifs. Tout est laissé à l’interprétation du joueur, ce qui ajoute une profondeur émotionnelle et une résonance personnelle à l’aventure. LIMBO ne donne pas de réponses faciles, mais invite à la réflexion.

✅ Un gameplay précis et fluide :
Les commandes sont simples et réactives, permettant au joueur de se concentrer sur l’exploration et la résolution d’énigmes. La précision du gameplay est essentielle dans un monde où le moindre faux pas peut entraîner une mort brutale.

Les Points Faibles :
⚠️ Une durée de vie limitée :
Avec une campagne qui peut être complétée en 4 à 5 heures, LIMBO est relativement court. Cependant, la qualité de chaque moment compense largement sa brièveté.

⚠️ Une répétition dans les mécaniques :
Vers la fin, certains puzzles peuvent sembler moins inspirés ou plus prévisibles. Cela n’affecte pas gravement l’expérience globale, mais mérite d’être mentionné.

⚠️ Absence de rejouabilité significative :
Une fois l’aventure terminée, il y a peu de raisons de revenir, sauf pour redécouvrir l’ambiance ou débloquer des succès.

En conclusion :
LIMBO est une œuvre qui transcende les genres et s’inscrit comme un classique du jeu vidéo indépendant. Avec son ambiance unique, son gameplay fluide et sa narration minimaliste mais puissante, il offre une expérience qui reste gravée dans la mémoire longtemps après que l’écran s’éteint. Si vous aimez les jeux qui mélangent réflexion, esthétique et émotion, LIMBO est un incontournable.

🎮 Verdict final :
Un chef-d'œuvre visuel et sonore, porté par une simplicité magistrale. LIMBO prouve qu’un jeu n’a pas besoin de dialogues ou d’explosions pour raconter une histoire captivante.

⏳ Temps de jeu recommandé :

Première partie : 4 à 5 heures.
✨ Note personnelle : Une expérience à vivre au moins une fois. LIMBO est un voyage mélancolique qui vous hante bien après les crédits.

184431785.review:
[h3]Ein Jump'n'Run im schwarz-weißen-grauen Sidescrollerdesign[/h3]

Wer bei normalen Jump'n'Runs und Sidescrollershootern inzwischen eher gelangweilt ist, findet hier eine kurzweilige Ablenkung.
Die Grafik ist mit einem teilweise unscharfem Schwarz-weiss-grauem Leveldesign erst einmal gewöhnungsbedürftig.
Doch das einfache Spieldesign geht wieder zurück auf die Basis eines wahren Jump'n'Run.
Das Spiel arbeitet an einigen Stellen mit dem Prinzip des perfekten Timing und auch gibt es so manche Überraschung und interessanten Plotwechsel. 
Das Spiel hat ein festgelegtes Leveldesign und verliert damit nach dem ersten großen Spielmarathon bzw nach dem ersten kompletten Durchspielen schnell den Wiederspielspaß. 
Das Spiel kostet aktuell im Sale 99ct und selbst ein Preis von 5€ wäre noch in Ordnung. 



Die [b]Spielidee[/b] ist nicht sonderlich neu, aber im Ganzen gut gemacht (3/5 Sterne)
und die [b]Umsetzung[/b] ist spielerisch schön und leichtgängig. (3/5 Sterne)
Die [b]Grafik[/b] ist interessant und mal was anderes. (4/5) 
und der [b]Ton[/b]) ist nicht herrausragend aber okay (3/5)
[b]Die Steuerung[/b] ist einfach und eingängig (4/5 Sterne)
[b]Der Spielspaß[/b] ist zumindest für mindestens 6 Stunden gegeben (4/5 Sterne)
[b]Wiederspielbarkeit[/b] ist nur eingeschränkt gegeben (3/5 Sterne)
Die [b]Steam-Errungenschaften[/b] sind einige vorhanden und doch begegnet einem das eine oder andere Ziel schon zufällig.  (4/5 Sterne)

184169141.review:
⭐ Nota: 10/10

"Uma obra de arte minimalista que mergulha no sombrio e no desconhecido."

LIMBO é mais do que um jogo; é uma experiência visual, emocional e sensorial. Desde o momento em que você acorda no meio de um cenário monocromático nebuloso, é evidente que esta jornada será tão intrigante quanto desafiadora.

Pontos Fortes:
Atmosfera Única: A estética preto e branco cria uma sensação de mistério e melancolia, acompanhada por um design de som magistral que intensifica a imersão.
Jogabilidade Inteligente: Cada puzzle é desafiador na medida certa, exigindo raciocínio lógico e um timing preciso, sem nunca parecer injusto.
Narrativa Sutil: A ausência de diálogos ou explicações deixa a interpretação da história por conta do jogador, o que aprofunda a conexão emocional com o game.
Duração Perfeita: Com cerca de 3 a 5 horas de gameplay, LIMBO não se prolonga além do necessário, entregando uma experiência condensada e impactante.
Pontos a Considerar:
Dificuldade Pontual: Alguns puzzles podem parecer frustrantes no início, mas a sensação de superação ao resolvê-los compensa.
História Ambígua: Para quem gosta de enredos claros e explicações definitivas, a falta de respostas pode ser um ponto de estranhamento.
Conclusão:
LIMBO é um jogo para aqueles que apreciam o inesperado e estão dispostos a se perder em um mundo sombrio, mas incrivelmente belo. Ele redefine o conceito de narrativa e puzzle-platformer, mostrando como simplicidade pode ser poderosa.

Se você procura uma experiência que ficará na memória muito depois dos créditos finais, LIMBO é uma escolha obrigatória.

💬 "Você está perdido ou encontrou seu propósito? LIMBO faz você questionar a própria jornada."

Recomendado para:
Jogadores que gostam de jogos atmosféricos como Inside ou Journey, fãs de puzzles inteligentes e apreciadores de arte nos videogames.

🔥 Compra obrigatória para qualquer biblioteca da Steam!

Limbo é um jogo de Puzzle com estética sombria e até macabra sobre um rapaz que acorda em uma floresta e tem que seguir uma jornada a partir dali.

Os puzzles do jogo são ótimos, a atmosfera é misteriosa e não se quebra nem quando o assunto são os tutoriais, é um ótimo exemplo de "você é solto no mundo". Gosto muito da linearidade que o jogo trás e como isso te prende sem ser massante!

É um jogo clássico, tranquilo de se terminar, leve e que tem um valor muito grande no universo dos jogos, um incrível exemplo de como unir gameplay e visuais e criar uma gameplay cinematrográfica.

Para os amantes de conquistas, o jogo também proporciona cartas na steam, itens colecionáveis que dão conquistas e um desafio de speedrun. Eu não sou ninguém, mas eu recomendo a compra para qualquer um que se interesse pela experiência!

184109038.review:
[h1]A Lucid Abstraction[/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3395103700
[i]There will be a TL;DR at the end.[/i]
 
~
 
It’s a simple thing.
A very simple thing.
Yet here I am, having started the game again after having played it 4 times before.

I originally downloaded [i]Playdead[/i]’s premiere experience back in 2012 on my [b]XBOX 360[/b]. I played through it twice, and then a few years later I revisited the experience and played through again before retiring my aging console.
When I first got [i]LIMBO[/i] here on [i]Steam[/i], it felt like a part of my collection was complete. I played through it with a joyous heart, and now that I’m revisiting it - it’s astonishing how little has changed.

The industry is replete with sidescrolling platforms, ‘atmospheric’ walking simulators, simplistic games with impressive graphics; each and every time many such games are replayed, the sharpness of the experience grows increasingly dull. After over 12 years, you’d think that opinions may shift, that maturity and a grown pallet may do away with more naive digestion.

There is a particular quality of [i]LIMBO[/i] that escapes conventional description. The screenshots and written expressions simply don’t do the experience justice. It’s an artistic, silhouette-based side-scrolling, platformer puzzle game. It’s the same as those old [b]Mario[/b] levels we all enjoyed as kids. 2D “hold-right-to-proceed” isn’t new, so what does [i]LIMBO[/i] have that others don’t?

Between the film grain, pulsating lights, phenomenal audio, and progressive setpieces - there is a very specific world on display that brings you from place to place in a seemingly endless explosion of liminal imagination.

The lack of color and depth are betrayed by the vivid shading of background elements and the innate ability for the human mind to fulfill the demands of such gaps. Initially it’s very simple to dismiss the form - trying to make do with crude outlines and no colors is a [u]cheap[/u] way of making a product, and yet [i]Playdead[/i] has managed to make the style work [b]for[/b] them.

Combined together, everything coalesces into something that feels like a lucid dream. Every time a new puzzle comes forward, the difference between the location and the last is staggeringly strange, yet somehow feels organic in some twist of subconscious anti-logic.

I am biased, because lots of things that are displayed in this game reflect aspects of dreams I’ve had in my past - dreams that I remember to this day. It calls back to something visceral inside of my mind; I do not credit this to my own insights, but rather to the brilliant and seamless artistry of [i]LIMBO[/i]’s creators.

The set pieces are relentless, and what are essentially simplistic puzzles often are presented in perplexing and very lethal ways. Traps are sprung and lessons are learned with horrendous consequences - but there is always a cunning guile behind the puzzles that creates an air of interest. While it feels as though you are learning more and more about the insane world of [i]LIMBO[/i] - the more you learn, the less you understand. While it is a place of concrete, steel, wood, and bone - it is also a plane of cosmic madness and the utter annihilation of sanity. It is familiar on a basic level, yet beyond comprehension. It is akin to a dream on the edge of waking.

In the same breath that you may prattle along the grassy underbrush of some antediluvian forest, you may find yourself striking the sky with thunder using an ancient machine to cause weather to change from a cloudy clear into torrential rain. Part of your brain, buried deep inside, knows that these two settings don’t belong - yet somehow you’re here, and the transition never truly registered. How did you go from [spoiler]fleeing a giant spider[/spoiler] to [spoiler]giant pneumatic crusher traps[/spoiler], and then to [spoiler]neon signs above a long-abandoned hotel[/spoiler] - but now are in an [spoiler]anti-gravity industrial complex[/spoiler]?
More importantly.
Why does it feel like this is the way it should be?
Why does it make sense to you?

You know why you’re here, don’t you? You’ve been here before.

You belong here.
 
~
 
[h3]TL;DR[/h3]
[b]9/10[/b]
[i]LIMBO[/i] is an [b]Amazing[/b] game.
It’s small, it’s simple, and it has so little -
But it has you.
You are all it really ever needed.

Limbo is a difficult game for me to review. On one hand, it has an amazing aesthetic and atmosphere that work together to create a very eerie and lonely feeling. Most of the puzzles are very satisfying to figure out, adding to the overall experience. However, on the other hand, some puzzles are almost impossible to solve. For instance, near the end of the game, there’s a puzzle I only solved by accident. The button you’re supposed to push blends into the background so much that I’m not sure how anyone could figure it out.



Another issue I had was with the game’s ending, which I found underwhelming considering everything I had to go through. To make matters worse, the game kept freezing every time I reached the ending, and I end haveing to watch it on YouTube. only later find out that the ending doesn’t work if you’re playing in windowed mode. When I finally got to see the ending, I couldn’t help but think, “Is that it?” It just happens without much impact, leaving me feeling disappointed.



Despite my complaints, I still give Limbo a positive review. The art style and atmosphere are incredibly memorable, and you can really feel the passion of the developers in every aspect of the game. Plus, it frequently goes on sale for very cheap, so when it gos sale mabye give it shot

1. STORY
-[b]PROS[/b]: Although at first, you don’t quite get the hang of it, to be honest, even by the end you don’t fully figure it out, it’s still a captivating experience. It has no dialogues, allowing you to form your own theories as you delve deeper into the game.

-[b]CONS[/b]: The lack of a clear story and the unclear ending might leave players feeling confused.

2. GAMEPLAY
-[b]PROS[/b]: When it comes to gameplay, I’m not complaining—I love puzzle games and platformers, and this game is a great combination of both. The puzzles are ingeniously designed, focusing heavily on physics and logic. What can I say? I’m glad I enjoy puzzles! Plus, the controls are simple: ARROWS MWAHAHAHAHAAH (NO MO WASD, DO YOU HEAR ME) and CTRL.

[b]CONS[/b]: Sometimes it can get frustrating; there’s a lot of trial-and-error involved. This is definitely a game that will test your patience—with your monitor.

3. GRAPHICS
[b]PRO[/b] I believe the monochromatic style brings a darker yet unique atmosphere, with black and white symbolizing the battle between light and darkness, you could say. It amplifies the players' emotions—TENSION, BRING ME THE TENSION, AND THAT SPIDER!

[b]CONS[/b]: While the style is downright impressive, the lack of vibrant colors—or any colors at all—might not appeal to everyone.

4. AUDIO
-[b]PROS[/b]: The sound doesn’t really have a traditional soundtrack; instead, it relies on ambient noises—rain, birds (I think), splashing water, wind, creaking trees, chewing, AND SPIDER SOUNDS (I will not stop, that maderfluff). It gives you a constant sense of unease, as if you’re completely isolated and in constant danger.
-no cons

HE COMPLETED FORZA HORIZON 4 AND MANY MORE I swear, for me, he’s an example. 5. DIFFICULTY-> So, this is very debatable, and I will start with this...
-[b]PROS[/b]: It’s great if you enjoy challenges; the difficulty of the puzzles increases gradually, based on logic and physics, making you use your brain.
[b]CONS[/b]: It can become difficult, the trial-and-error mechanics can be frustrating at times, and the lack of guidance can make some puzzles frustrating.

6. GAME LENGHT
The game has a duration of 3-5 hours, which makes it short but well-focused. However, some players might think the story ends too quickly, but not in my case; I stayed AFK for about 2 and a half hours, I think. Por mais que jogos de puzzle não sejam muito meu estilo, LIMBO foi um jogo que chamou bastante a minha atenção e conseguiu me prender na gameplay por horas, me fazendo pensar em diversas possibilidades para a solução de seus desafios até achar finalmente a resposta certa. A ambientação toda escura do vazio, com alguns pontos de iluminação, causa uma sensação de leve desconforto misturada com medo em certos momentos e áreas do jogo, sendo um estilo de arte bem bonito e aterrorizante ao mesmo tempo.
Os puzzles do jogo não são muito difíceis, mas as vezes requerem soluções criativas sem procurar muito o óbvio.
[spoiler]Uma parte muito interessante do jogo é a fase secreta, que é desbloqueada após conseguir todos os coletáveis. Nela a sua audição vai ser mais importante que tudo, necessitando de prestar atenção no som do ambiente para poder passar por diversos obstáculos, já que praticamente a fase inteira se passa sem ilumição, te deixando no completo [b]limbo[/b].[/spoiler]
Finalizando, o jogo com certeza é muito bom e bastante divertido, garanto que aqueles que gostam mais que eu de jogos de puzzle poderão se divertir ainda mais com LIMBO!

183777199.review:
Спустя 14 лет осилил LImbo. 

В год её выхода всеобщих восторгов я не разделил. Тогда этот «мини-шедевр», расхваленный прессой, показался скучным и претенциозным. В 2010 году инди-индустрия меня в принципе мало интересовала - хороших крупнобюджетных игр было завались, и на их фоне LImbo выглядела так же блекло, как её внутриигровой дизайн. Это сегодня из-за оскудения рынка зажравшиеся геймеры, вроде меня, возвращаются в прошлое и дают шанс проектам, которые не попали в настроение, а тогда игровой урожай был богатый. 

В 2014 я запустил Limbo во второй раз. Через силу прошёл дальше середины и выключил. Объяснить почему, не могу - просто было неинтересно.   

И вот в 2024 я прошёл Limbo до конца. В этот раз мой вердикт: «хорошо»! С одним «но»: исключительно как стильный пазл-платформер. 

Самый главный плюс игры: виузал. Стилистика в духе театра теней, причудливый дизайн локаций, атмосфера сказочности вкупе с ощущением сурового приключения в мире а-ля «Божественная комедия» Данте - это то, из-за чего хочется запускать Limbo вновь и вновь. Но изучать его лор, вникать в аллюзии, лоскутки сюжета - это заниматься сизифовым трудом.

183539264.review: playdead somehow makes me feel so smart and so dumb with their puzzle platformers. this one is no exception! what i love most about playdead's storytelling, though, is its abstraction, which encourages the player to impose upon the game their own analyses. i think the obvious part is that this is a story about children who died in a car accident, but why they are in a purgatorial "limbo" and reliving traumatic memories is up to you. no, this one is not as good as inside (2016), but still very much worth your time and purchase.

183536172.review: Çok kötüydü. Bulmaca platform türüyle mi bir alıp veremediğim var bilmiyorum, fakat bu kadar yavaş bir karakteri yönetmek bana hitap etmiyor. Bulmacalar da güzel olmayınca oyun tek amacını kaybediyor ve geriye ne olduğu belirsiz, sıkıcı bir oyun kalıyor. Saçma bulmacalar, yürürken güzel bir fon müziğinin eşlik etmemesi, hikaye adına bir şey olmaması (ki bununla ilgili bir derdim yok), ama dediğim gibi bulmacalar da kötü olunca oyun her yönüyle sırıtmaya başlıyor. Sadece bitirmek için bitirdiğim bir yapımdı, beğenmedim.

183516195.review: É uma obra-prima em forma de jogo. Com seu estilo visual noir e uma jogabilidade única, ele captura a essência de um suspense sombrio e misterioso. A simplicidade dos controles contrasta com a profundidade emocional da narrativa, proporcionando uma experiência imersiva e tocante. Cada quebra-cabeça desafiador e cada momento de tensão contribuem para um mundo onde o jogador se sente verdadeiramente envolvido. A atmosfera é hipnotizante, e a jornada do protagonista é uma que fica com você muito depois que o jogo termina. Uma experiência imperdível para quem aprecia jogos que desafiam tanto a mente quanto o coração.
